title: Communities Suffer When Deadly Force Is Used In Pursuit Of Low-Level Crimes
teaser: Recent events in Ferguson, Missouri, and New York City have reopened the debate on police tactics. In New York, a grand jury is considering charges against an officer whose used a choke hold on a suspect, leading to the man's death. But records indicate the officer was no rogue cop. Instead, he's the embodiment of a common but controversial approach to policing.
